page.title: 03Houses & gardens in Ousden
page.content: The houses vary in size, age and appearance. Some have as many as 6 or 7 rooms, and some are more modest with 3 or 4. All have modern amenities with piped water, electricity, at least one bathroom and an indoor lavatory, but houses away from centre of village do not have main drainage. Most of the dwellings are owner occupied, 1 or 2 are weekend retreats, and the council houses are mostly rented. A few of the houses are picturesquely thatched and there are a few bungalows. One house, the Rectory dates from 1600, and this has been successfully renovated over the years. One interesting conversion is the village school now a private house. The size of gardens varies from a quarter to one acre, and these are often landscaped and laid out with lawns and flowerbeds. About \ the inhabitants grow some vegetables.
